intro: [WRONG START] Pyrrocoma turbinella, commonly known as the Turbinella snail, is a species of sea snail belonging to the family Turbinellidae. It is characterized by its elongated, spiral shell that is typically smooth and glossy, with a distinct conical shape. The shell coloration can vary, often displaying shades of brown or pink, depending on the habitat. This species is primarily found in tropical and subtropical marine environments, where it inhabits sandy or muddy substrates. Its anatomy includes a muscular foot used for locomotion and a radula for feeding on algae and detritus.
